title: Game Lag, Details in Post
body:
My game appears to be lagging hard whenever I play (even against custom AI bots), an issue that appears to have started within the last 2-3 weeks.  Sometimes my ping registers as spiking up, sometimes it doesn't.  But at this point, my game is nearly unplayable.  I just got rolled as Syndra against Ekko because I was teleporting around my screen - and during that entire process, my ping was at 67.  I was having some issues earlier as well, playing Gangplank, but nowhere near as bad as my Syndra experience was.

I am almost positive this started after 6.16, but I can't figure out what on my PC could be contributing to this issue.  I run Windows 10, and have had many issues with Windows 10 in the past.  Since October, I haven't even been able to get the apps/app store to work on this.  Not sure if that is contributing any, but it hasn't so far.

As I am very techno-illiterate, I would appreciate any help/directions that can be given.  


Edit:

I tend to run this game at a cap of 75-90 fps, and it isn't dipping when I enter fights.  It's just...jerking around, is the best way I can put it.

Edit 2:

I use AVG (the most recent, free build). 

Edit 3:

replies.body: It does sound like your network is having problems staying connected, which is pretty critical because the game requires a constant connection.  Run a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader)  in the matches where you have this ping spikes for an overview of what's going wrong.  The results will also provide a list of steps to take specific to your case.  I hope that helps!

Just ran it for the last 3 games I had severe issues in.  While ping was steady (and did occasionally spike) it says my packet loss is hovering at about 4.7%

Are there any ways I can go about fixing this? Find out if I have firewalls buggering my playing experience? I'm just about done configuring the Hextech repair download.

As a first step, I suggest using our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)  guide to strengthen your connection and fix up whatever is causing packet loss.  You can also use the [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) to automatically configure settings like your firewall.  Let me know if that helps out!

Can you guys take an actual look at this issue please.   I understand you're supposed to copy and paste this information to everyone but this is a serious issue that many players have been having, myself included. 

Its incredibly frustrating to deal with and there is nothing I have done that has helped fix the issue other than wait and pray for it to be working properly later or the next day.

EDIT:  My own post on this issue that I submitted yesterday  -    http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/EVRv9AAn-has-there-been-server-connection-issues-instability-for-any-other-time-warner-users-out-there

I'll give that a go, but while I am on wifi I have no issues whatsoever loading and playing on other games.  Hearthstone, WoW, TF2, LotRO, my latency/ping typically cap out at 120 on those, while League actually has my best connections.

I will run the reader for my previous games though, and I appreciate the response :D Hope it works!

Edited because I'm a lummox who thought it needed to be active during the game.

I myself have been having a very similar issue. Up until a month ago I played with 40 ping when my connection was fine, but ever since about the 20th of July or so, my ping has been hovering around 80, which alone would be fine, but about every minute or so I'll get a ping spike, accompanied by the gameplay stopping for a few seconds, then speeding back up to catch up. It's enough to make me not want to play any pvp matches because of how often it happens. And when I tried some of the featured game modes, I discovered that the ping spikes grew more frequent as the game went on, until the game was barely playable for extended periods of time. 

I still can't figure out what is causing this issue, and what might have changed to cause it to spring up, as I'm not tech-savvy at all.
